\maketitle

\begin{abstract}

We analyze the annual--modulation effect, measured by the DAMA 
Collaboration with the new implementation of a further two--years 
running,  in the context of a possible interpretation in  
terms of relic neutralinos. We impose over 
the set of supersymmetric configurations, selected by 
the annual--modulation data, the constraints derived from WIMP indirect 
measurements, and discuss the features of the ensuing relic 
neutralinos. We critically discuss the sources of the main 
 theoretical uncertainties in the analysis of event rates for 
direct and indirect WIMP searches.  
 
\end{abstract}  

\vspace{1cm}
